title: Bruni 2016 Plinio White (Maremma Toscana)
description: The nose on this 85% Vermentino and 15% Viognier blend reveals delicate aromas of candied citrus and almond. The palate is straightforward, offering white peach and bitter almond notes.

title: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Bruised apple peel and very ripe, yellow pear signal ripeness and abundant fruit. While the palate is light it is similarly generous with fruit, helped along by a touch of residual sweetness. This is fruity and friendly, with an off-dry finish. Drink soon.

title: Felline 2015 Alberello Red (Salento)
description: Immensely fruity in strawberry and blackberry aromas and flavors, additional bubble gum spice tones add some depth. Overall this is broad and juicy in feel, with just enough balance from the soft tannins and acid.

title: Ivory and Burt 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Candied flavors like caramel and butterscotch make this full-bodied wine seem sweet, while a lush, soft texture coats the palate.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2016 Montado Red (Alentejano)
description: This soft wine is attractive, packed with red-fruit crispness and plenty of acidity. The wine is all bright fruit, no wood aging. Drink now.

title: Karl Josef 2016 Piesporter Michelsberg White (Mosel)
description: While quiet on the nose, hints of fresh apple and blossoms are a pleasant introduction to this brisk, uncomplicated white blend. Off dry and light in body, it's an easy quaffing wine, with a fresh grapefruit finish.

title: La Fiera 2016 Primitivo (Salento)
description: Jammy red berry aromas and flavors mix with grilled herbs and are grounded by a sanguine vein. Medium in weight and structure, the acidity starts off soft but builds on the midpalate, offering a bit a levity on the finish.

title: Loriñon 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are a bit stalky and flat. This crianza is firm and choppy, but also stewed on the palate. Spicy plum and olive flavors are ordinary if not a touch underripe.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Oily aromas of orange peel are lively but imprecise. This Verdejo ranks as fruity but simple, with plumpness and citric acidity. Briny citrus flavors give off a sense of grape skins that extend onto the finish.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Cuvée Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Reduction clings to the nose but the body is fresh and clean. This is dry and lacks a little fruit and direction but has freshness to redeem itself. The finish is dry and clean. Drink soon.

title: Maryhill 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of white flower, lemon curd and spice are followed by sleek, light fruit flavors. It's a straightforward, varietally correct wine.

title: Maysara 2016 Arsheen Pinot Gris (McMinnville)
description: Pungent pineapple aromas, along with a hint of kerosene, indicate that this will not be your standard style of Oregon Pinot Gris. The intense herbaceous character dominates, suggesting some of the stylistic terminology that might accompany a particularly biting Sauvignon Blanc. Some 10% was fermented in concrete egg.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Citizen's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: An entry-level effort, this has thinly-ripened berry flavors, stiff tannins and acids like a squeeze of fresh lemon juice. But it is the aggressive earthy and herbal components that dominate and continue to resonate through the finish.

title: Pinord NV M Marrugat Brut Rosé Familiar Sparkling (Spain)
description: Powdery nectarine and orange-rind aromas comprise the nose on this tangy rosé Cava with a soda-like mouthfeel. Slightly tart apricot and orange flavors show latent bitterness prior to a yeasty-tasting finish that's not that long.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: A hearty 12% Cabernet Sauvignon is added to this wine, which is aged in 100% French oak. Reduced, with sizable oak influence, it shows dried herb components wrapped in bittersweet black pepper and leather.

title: Rosemont 2015 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: Almost tawny in color, this wine offers aromas of red and black plum, dried fig and prune, with secondary notes of cedar and balsamic. These aromas translate onto the palate where the tannins are abundant, yet silky, and the acidity isn't shy.

title: Seacampo 2016 Monte Serra Branco White (Dão)
description: This lightly perfumed wine is also crisp and fruity. Good acidity, citrus fruit and a zesty texture give freshness and a bright character. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Senda Verde 2016 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Melon and kiwi aromas are a touch green. This wine feels tangy but also plump, while lemon-lime flavors give way to skins-driven bitterness. A bland finish with residual tang is direct in feel.

title: Shelburne 2015 Marquette (Vermont)
description: Smoky roast beef aromas mingle with peppercorns and black cherries on the foxy nose. The palate shows ripe cherry and cranberry, alongside cedar, pepper and sweet baking spices. The tannins provide an appealing grip, with balanced acidity and good structure. The finish kicks off on peppery spice then softens into raspberries.

title: Sunset Hills 2016 Viognier (Virginia)
description: This Viognier is bursting with passion fruit, honeydew, peach and elderflower aromas that carry right through to the palate. The mouthfeel is a little flimsy but there are great flavors here.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2015 Barrel Select Kody's Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is part of the winery's Winemaker Series, a limited production wine that was barrel-aged for 17 months in two-thirds new French oak. It remains stiff and quite astringent, with vanilla being the principal flavor. In fact, there is so much vanilla that it more or less covers most of the fruit.

title: William Marie 2016 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Fruit for this wine comes from Block 66 of Double Canyon Vineyard in the Horse Heaven Hills. The aromas aren't entirely harmonious, with notes of dark, slightly overripe-seeming fruit along with black pepper and licorice, showing some volatility. The black-raspberry flavors are light and compact. It doesn't come together.

title: Cantele 2014 Riserva Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)
description: Sarsaparilla, cherry and blackberry show medium intensity on the nose. Light in feel, with juicy dark fruit flavors shot through with pomegranate acidity, the palate is supported by medium-grained tannins. A light cherry cola flavor rounds out the finish.

title: Cantina Le Grotte 2015 Selva Della Rocca Falanghina (Puglia)
description: Soft aromas of lemon oil, dried hay and crushed stone carry the nose. The palate shows a bit more ripeness in yellow apple and grapefruit flavors, with a mild vein of acidity offering some balance.

title: Château de Cérons 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. This wine shows stalky fruit and dusty tannins. Its acidity and spice come through strongly along with attractive black currant fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink early.

title: Château Rahoul 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. Very herbal, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is taut and nervy, with a grassy character and cool gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Mayne de Valence 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This wine is ripe, bright with black-currant fruit and crisp acidity. It is simple, easy and fruity. Oak aging gives a smooth character to the soft, warm wine that is ready to drink.

title: Casteller NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty pear and melon aromas are basic. That could be said for the palate, which is soda-like. Mild citrus and apple flavors dry out on a finish with grassy notes.

title: Château Bournac 2015  Médoc
description: Soft and fruity, this is an easy wine to drink. Its tannins are light and smoky, leaving plenty of room for the smooth, rounded fruits. It is not a wine for long aging, so drink from 2019.

title: Château de la Croix 2015  Médoc
description: With more Cabernet Sauvignon than Merlot, this wine has delicious black-currant flavors as well as a dry edge to the tannins from 12 months in wood. It leaves a bright, fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
